thread.title: NDP leader Tom Mulcair makes campaign stop in Maple Ridge
thread.title_full: NDP leader Tom Mulcair makes campaign stop in Maple Ridge - NEWS 1130

author: Mike Lloyd
title: NDP leader Tom Mulcair makes campaign stop in Maple Ridge
text:
Summary On the campaign trail, Tom Mulcair highlighted NDP promises for healthcare, childcare and infrastructure investments
VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – Once again promising billions of dollars in new funding for transit infrastructure, NDP leader Tom Mulcair continued a campaign swing through BC with a stop in Maple Ridge this morning.
He told an enthusiastic crowd, many holding “Stop Harper” signs, that only the New Democrats are in a position to defeat the Conservative government next Monday. “The NDP needs just 35 more seats to defeat the Conservatives, just 35 more seats to stop Stephen Harper’s secret trade agreement and bring change to Ottawa,” he said.
“The Liberals simply can’t do it. They need over 100 seats. Only the NDP can defeat the Conservatives and only the NDP can deliver the change we’ve been waiting for.”
Mulcair reiterated promises that an NDP government would hire new doctors and healthcare professionals in the Lower Mainland, work with the province to create more than 50,000 “15-dollar-a-day” childcare spaces, and deliver $5.2 billion in new infrastructure investment for projects like Surrey light-rail transit and the Broadway SkyTrain extension in Vancouver.
